00022                 defset[id] = true;

00040 bool
00041 MMLmo::validate() {
00042         if (validated) {
00043                 return valid;
00044         }
00045         valid = true;
00046         validated = true;
00047         // an mo element may only contain MMLtext elements
00048         if (first != last) {
00049                 errmsg = "An mo element may only contain at most one text "
00050                         "element.";
00051                 valid = false;
00052                 return false;
00053         }
00054         if (!first) return true;
00055         if (!first->isText()) {
00056                 errmsg = "An mo element may only contain one text element.";
00057                 valid = false;
00058                 return false;
00059         }
00060         MMLText *i = static_cast<MMLText *>(first);
00061         lookupOperator(i->data());
00062         widthset = heightset = false;
00063         return true;
00064 }

00073                                 att[j] = i->second[j];
00074                         }
00075                 }
00076         }*/
00077 }
00078 void
00079 MMLmo::doLayout(MML::Attributes *a) const {
00080         if (!first) return;
00081 
00082         // the value of 'form' is a bit complicated. we use 'infix' for now
00083         //createAttribute(MML::FORM, "infix", id, att);
00084         // set the default attributes depending on the contents of the
00085         // element
00086         float lspace = a->lspace().get(a);
00087         float rspace = a->rspace().get(a);
00088         MMLText *m = static_cast<MMLText *>(first);
00089 //      printf("%s: %f, %f\n", m->data().ascii(), lspace, rspace);
00090         first->layout(a);
00091         if (a->stretchy()) {
00092                 MMLText *n = static_cast<MMLText *>(first);
00093 //              printf("stretchy operator: %s\n", n->data().ascii());
00094                 if (widthset) {
00095                         gui->width = setwidth;
00096                         n->setWidth(gui->width - lspace - rspace);
00097                 }
00098                 if (heightset) {
00099                         gui->ascent = setascent;
00100                         gui->descent = setdescent;
00101                         n->setHeight(gui->ascent, gui->descent);
00102                 }
00103         }
00104         if (!a->stretchy() || !widthset) {
00105                 gui->width = lspace + first->getWidth() + rspace;
00106         }
00107         if (!a->stretchy() || !heightset) {
00108                 gui->ascent = first->getAscent();
00109                 gui->descent = first->getDescent();
00110         }
00111 
00112         first->setX(lspace);
00113 }

00131 // call this function *before* you call 'layout'
00132 // it is used to set the already known dimensions of the mo element
00133 // if the attribute is stretchy, it can adapt to the information
00134 void
00135 MMLmo::setHeight(float sa, float sd) {
00136         heightset = true;
00137         setascent = sa;
00138         setdescent = sd;
00139 }
00140 void
00141 MMLmo::setWidth(float sw) {
00142         widthset = true;
00143         setwidth = sw;
00144 }
00145 // static functions for initializing the operator dictionary
00146 void
00147 MMLmo::makedict() {
00148         madedict = true;
00149         for (int i=0; i<351; ++i) {
00150                 const char *end;
00151                 const char *start = rawopdict[i];
00152                 const char *send = start+strlen(start);
00153                 end = strchr(start, ' ');
00154                 DOMString op;
00155                 for (const char *j=start; j!=end; ++j) {
00156                         op += *j;
00157                 }
00158                 const MMLAttribute **a
00159                         = new const MMLAttribute*[MML::moNumAtts];
00160                 for (uint j=0; j<MML::moNumAtts; ++j) {
00161                         a[j] = 0;
00162                 }
00163                 while (*end != '\0') {
00164                         std::string name;
00165                         start = end+1;
00166                         end = strchr(start, '=');
00167                         for (const char *j=start; j!=end; ++j) {
00168                                 name += *j;
00169                         }
00170                         start = end+1;
00171                         end = strchr(start, ' ');
00172                         if (!end) end = send;
00173                         DOMString value;
00174                         for (const char *j=start; j!=end; ++j) {
00175                                 value += *j;
00176                         }
00177                         setAttribute(op.utf8(), name, value, a);
00178                 }
00179 //              dict.insert(pair<DOMString, MMLAttribute **>(op, a));
00180 //              DOMString uni = op;
00181                 op.resolveEntities();
00182 //              if (uni != op) {
00183                         dict.insert(pair<DOMString, const MMLAttribute **>
00184                                 (op, a));
00185 //              }
00186         }
00187 }
00188 /* this function sets an attribute in a dictionary entry */
00189 void
00190 MMLmo::setAttribute(const char *op, const std::string &name, const DOMString &v,
00191                 const MMLAttribute **a) {
00192         int pos = createAttribute(name.c_str(), v, MML::MO, a);
00193         if (pos == -1) {
00194                 cerr << "internal error in MMLmo::makedict: invalid attribute '"
00195                         << name << "', value invalid: '" << v.utf8()
00196                         << "' for operator '" << op << "'." << endl;
00197                 exit(1);
00198         }
00199 }
